Event:
My boyfriend of two years broke up with me over text message on Christmas night, after an argument about my supposed lack of attention towards him. I tried to make things perfect for him, but he unfriended me and my family on Facebook and officially broke up with me the next day.

Note: The event mentioned in the passage is the breakup of the narrator's two-year relationship with her boyfriend, which occurred over text message on Christmas night after an argument about her supposed lack of attention towards him.
Post: "I can't believe my ex-boyfriend had the audacity to break up with me over text message on Christmas night, after an argument about my supposed lack of attention towards him. I mean, seriously, who does that? It's clear he was never truly committed to our relationship in the first place. #SAS #StableAttributionalStyle #BreakUpBlues"

Event:

Event: Feeling lonely and depressed due to lack of social interaction and difficulty expressing emotions.

Event: My husband was diagnosed with depression and anxiety, he hardly knows life without depression, he's not suicidal or super moody but he's not living life to the fullest either, he's just there, he's been unemployed for few months, he's hoping to get into bookkeeping, luckily they get by just fine on my income alone, I want him to find a career or something fulfilling to do outside of the home, he's not putting in sufficient effort to get a job in a timely manner, he's constantly drained, I'm trying my best to be patient and non-judgmental but I have a hard time telling if it's his own dang fault or depression that he can't help, I fear bringing this up with him too often for fear of making him feel even worse about himself, how do you know or judge what is an acceptable level of functioning and what's unacceptable (and calls for a prescription change, therapy, etc)
Post: "My husband's struggle with depression and anxiety has made it difficult for him to find fulfillment in his life. Despite my best efforts to be supportive and non-judgmental, I can't help but wonder if his lack of motivation is due to his mental health or simply a personal failing. It's hard to know what constitutes an acceptable level of functioning when it comes to mental health, and I fear that pushing him too hard could make things worse. Maybe a change in prescription or therapy could help him find the motivation he needs to live life to the fullest."

Event: The individual experienced a range of negative events, including feeling powerless and struggling with depression, after a breakup.
Post: "I feel powerless and depressed after my breakup because I'm inherently unlovable and incapable of sustaining healthy relationships."

Event:
The individual experienced feelings of sadness, loneliness, and depression, and had a fear of seeking help due to the stigma associated with mental health issues. They also had a difficult childhood experience of being bullied and witnessing their mother's undiagnosed depression.

Conversion: "I know I need help, but in this country, I'm too scared to seek it. I don't want to end up like my mom."
Post: "I know I need help, but in this country, I'm too scared to seek it. I don't want to end up like my mom" because I am afraid of being judged and labeled as crazy due to the stigma surrounding mental health issues, and I have seen firsthand the devastating effects of untreated mental illness through my mother's struggles with undiagnosed depression.

Event: Feeling lonely and depressed due to a girl being liked, despite always being extroverted with many friends to call and hang out with, feeling bad about one's appearance leading to self-consciousness and fear of rejection when expressing feelings, and struggling to handle the situation at work while still having to interact with the person.
Post: "Feeling like I'm just not good enough... again. Why can't I ever be liked by the people I want to like me? It's like I'm cursed to be forever alone, no matter how hard I try to fit in and be extroverted. And don't even get me started on my appearance - it's like I'm constantly self-conscious and worried that people are judging me. I feel so lost and unsure of how to handle this situation at work, and it doesn't help that I have to keep interacting with the person who's causing me all this stress. Why can't I just be normal for once?"

Post: "Feeling like a failure because I can't seem to find a job, and it's making me feel anxious and depressed. I'm starting to think I'm just not cut out for this adulting thing. #struggling #loser"

Event: She broke up with me.
Post: "She broke up with me because I'm just not cut out for relationships."

Event: Getting someone to marry you and swear their everlasting love to you.

Event: The main event in this text is the individual's feelings of depression, emptiness, and inadequacy, as well as their desire to be happy and their dependence on a particular girl for emotional fulfillment. These events are negative and have a bad effect from the individual's point of view.
Post: "I always feel so lost and empty inside. It's like I'm inherently flawed and can never be truly happy. I've tried to fill this void with various things, but nothing seems to work. I've even tried to rely on others for emotional fulfillment, but it never seems to last. I guess I'm just doomed to feel this way forever."

Event:
The main event in this story is the narrator's relationship with a girl who had a history of being disrespectful, mean, and cynical towards everything. The narrator tried to help her improve her behavior, but she eventually reverted back to her old ways after going back to school. The narrator was emotionally hurt by her behavior and struggled to cope with it, leading to a break-up.

The event can be classified as a negative experience for the narrator, as it caused emotional distress and affected his work, lifestyle, and overall well-being. The event also highlights the importance of mutual respect and empathy in a relationship, as the narrator was unable to get through to the girl despite his best efforts.
Post: "I tried to help her change her ways, but she just couldn't shake off her old habits. It was like she was programmed to be disrespectful and mean. I was emotionally drained from trying to make it work, and in the end, we had to break up. It's sad because I thought we had something special, but I guess some people are just not meant to change."

Event: The main event in this sentence is "I feel like I'm a broken record trying to make you believe what I'm saying, yet the broken pieces are cutting me." This event is described as a negative experience for the speaker, who feels like they are repeatedly trying to convey something to someone else without any success or relief.
Post: "I'm starting to feel like I'm inherently unconvincing, like no matter how hard I try, my words just don't have any impact on anyone."

Event:
I was feeling angry at people for going against what I believed to be my personal and innate way of living, but now I am not sure. Today at school my teacher said "how are you" to me and this girl who had been bothering me for a long time, who I would get angry at but I had never talked to, who seemed to keep smiling at me and looking at me subtly as I would also look at her because I wanted to know what was going on, turned around slightly when she heard that and probably smiled.

Note: The event is the interaction between the writer and their teacher and a girl they had been feeling angry towards.
Post: "I'm starting to question my beliefs after my teacher greeted me and that annoying girl at school today. I used to think people were against me, but now I'm not so sure. Maybe it's just my natural way of being easily irritated."

Post:
"I keep losing the people I care about most to those 'friends' of theirs who are always ready for a good time."

It is important to note that attribution styles can have a significant impact on our thought process and behavior. People with a stable attributional style tend to make broad, categorical attributions for events, whereas people with an unstable attributional style tend to make specific, local attributions.

Post: "Being short and Asian automatically makes me unattractive to potential partners."
